intro: Metagonia villosa, commonly known as the hairy metagonia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Metagonia villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
